title: Drawing, Design for Dining Table of Mahogany on Column-Like Supports, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for Dining Table of Mahogany on Column-Like Supports
medium: Graphite and yellow color pencil on thin, cream paper
inscribed: In graphite, at center right of design, with an arrow pointing to table top: "Branch veneer"; in graphite, at lower right of design, with an arrow pointing to the yellow foot: "Brass Foot"; in graphite, across bottom of sheet, at right: "DINING TABLE (of Mahogany)"; in graphite, above upper right of design: numerical notation indicating dimension.
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Round molded top with a dividing stretcher at center is raised on four reeded column-like supports sitting on molded rectangular basae terminating in four splayed legs with brass feet on casters indicated in yellow color pencil.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Dining Table of Mahogany on Column-Like Supports, 1900–05. Graphite and yellow color pencil on thin, cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-106.
